frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern to allow users to navigate and process a long list of items by progressively displaying additional items as needed.

when_to_use.value: **Focus attention on top results.** Display only the most relevant or initial options to reduce cognitive load while letting users access additional choices progressively.
**Paired with sorting.** Best implemented alongside default sorting or personalization tools that demonstrate results have been customized for the user.

design_principles.value: **Progressive disclosure.** Initially displays 5 options from a longer list.
**Incremental reveal.** Button trigger reveals 5 additional options at a time.
**Auto-hide trigger.** Button automatically hides when all options are visible.
**No unnecessary UI.** Button never appears if 5 or fewer options exist total.

when_not_to_use.value: **Static content disclosure.** Avoid this approach for revealing supplementary information unrelated to list items. Use the Additional info component instead for non-list supplementary content.

how_to_build.intro: The pattern progressively reveals list items with a button trigger.

steps.value: Initially display 5 options from the longer list.
Include a 'Show more' button that reveals 5 additional options at a time.
Button text format: 'Show [name of option] (#)' - e.g., 'Show past updates (3)'.
Automatically hide the button when all options are visible.
Once expanded, options remain visible (no collapse mechanism).
Never show the button if 5 or fewer options exist total.

accessibility.value: Implement aria-controls and aria-expanded attributes for assistive technology.
Assign heading role to trigger element for discoverability.
Set aria-level attribute on heading role element.
